main event: Control tower operators at Fairfield-Suisun Air Force Base observed an unidentified object on December 3, 1948.
interesting points: The object was first sighted approximately 2 miles north of the control tower, flying at an altitude between 500 and 1,000 feet., It appeared as a bright white light, estimated to be about 30 inches in diameter., The object took off vertically to an altitude of about 20,000 feet before disappearing., Observers used 8-power binoculars to observe the object, which showed no visible exhaust or sound., An archived weather balloon had been released shortly before the sighting, complicating the analysis.
witness description: Competent airmen working in the control tower, considered reliable and psychologically stable.
